t: Blessed*pn be the Lord,*s my rock who*ln trains my hands for battle and*ln my fingers for warfare.
He*ln is my faithful love and my fortress, my*ln stronghold and my deliverer. He*ln is my shield, and I take refuge in him; he*ln subdues my people under me.
Lord,*spn what is a human that you care for him, a*ln son of man that you think of him?
A*ln human is like a breath; his*ln days are like a passing shadow.
Lord,*spn part your heavens and come down. Touch*ln the mountains, and they will smoke.
Flash*ln your lightning and scatter the foe; shoot*ln your arrows and rout them.
Reach*ln down from on high; rescue*ln me from deep water, and set me free from*ln the grasp of foreigners
whose*ln mouths speak lies, whose*ln right hands are deceptive.
God,*pn I will sing a new song to you; I*ln will play on a ten-stringed harp for you—
the*ln one who gives victory to kings, who*ln frees his servant David from*ln the deadly sword.
Set*ln me free and rescue me from*ln foreigners whose*ln mouths speak lies, whose*ln right hands are deceptive.
Then*pn our sons will be like plants nurtured*ln in their youth, our*ln daughters, like corner pillars that*ln are carved in the palace style.
Our*ln storehouses will be full, supplying*ln all kinds of produce; our*ln flocks will increase by thousands and*ln tens of thousands in our open fields.
Our*ln cattle will be well fed. There*ln will be no breach in the walls, no*ln going into captivity, and*ln no cry of lament in our public squares.
Happy*ln are the people with such blessings. Happy*ln are the people whose God is the Lord.*s
